snippet: With a potential constitutional crisis and military coup being added to the danger already posed by jihadists, Iraq is desperate for a unifying hand.
abstract: Editorial urges Iraqi Prime Min Nuri Kamal al-Maliki to step aside and let Haider al-Abadi replace him as prime minister; contends country desperately needs a unifying hand at the helm, particularly in light of the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria militants who are rapidly overrunning the country.
lead_paragraph: With a potential constitutional crisis and military coup being added to the danger already posed by jihadists, Iraq is desperate for a unifying hand.

headline.main: Iraq Needs a New Prime Minister
headline.print_headline: Iraq Needs a New Prime Minister

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
